alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Hampton, Poquoson; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; Newport News; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:20AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS AND GUSTY WINDS WILL AFFECT MIDDLESEX...NORTHUMBERLAND...YORK... JAMES CITY...GLOUCESTER...KING AND QUEEN...CHARLES CITY...RICHMOND... NEW KENT...MATHEWS...WESTMORELAND...SOUTHEASTERN KING WILLIAM... SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX...AND LANCASTER COUNTIES...THE CITY OF POQUOSON... THE CITY OF HAMPTON...THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG... At 814 AM EDT, radar indicated gusty showers located across portions of the Peninsula, Middle Peninsula, and Northern Neck. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are possible with these showers. In addition, pockets of very heavy rainfall are possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, New Kent, King William, Williamsburg, Mathews, Charles City, Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Montross, Langley AFB, Fair Port, Talleysville, Gloucester Point, Robley and Deltaville. Strong wind gusts are possible with these showers. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Heavy rainfall is also occurring, and may cause localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
